title: Why are exoplanets so interesting to scientists? - Quora

response.answer_text: We’re looking for life out there, and it may become possible to do spectroscopic analysis of some promising planets to see if the kinds of compounds associated with life on Earth are there. We’d also like to understand our own solar system better. Back in the day it was (reasonably) assumed that we were typical. But to everyone’s surprise we have a unique layout among all the hundreds of solar systems mapped so far. That’s provocative, and it makes it less likely that there’s life out there.
